US10324197.title: Systems and methods for estimating initial heading at start-up of navigation
classifications: Instruments for performing navigational calculations specially adapted for indoor navigation

Determining position by combining or switching between position solutions derived from the satellite radio beacon positioning system and position solutions derived from a further system whereby the further system is an inertial position system, e.g. loosely-coupled

Navigation; Navigational instruments not provided for in groups G01C1/00 - G01C19/00 by using measurements of speed or acceleration executed aboard the object being navigated; Dead reckoning by integrating acceleration or speed, i.e. inertial navigation

Navigation; Navigational instruments not provided for in groups G01C1/00 - G01C19/00 by using measurements of speed or acceleration executed aboard the object being navigated; Dead reckoning by integrating acceleration or speed, i.e. inertial navigation combined with non-inertial navigation instruments

Navigation; Navigational instruments not provided for in groups G01C1/00 - G01C19/00 by using measurements of speed or acceleration executed aboard the object being navigated; Dead reckoning by integrating acceleration or speed, i.e. inertial navigation combined with non-inertial navigation instruments with electromagnetic compass
Detecting state or type of motion
Hybrid positioning by combining or switching between positions derived from two or more separate positioning systems at least one of the systems being a non-radio wave positioning system
Trajectory determination or predictive filtering, e.g. target tracking or Kalman filtering

US10511971.title: Systems and methods for location enabled search and secure authentication
classifications: Business processes related to the transportation industry

Rendez-vous, i.e. searching a destination where several users can meet, and the routes to this destination for these users; Ride sharing, i.e. searching a route such that at least two users can share a vehicle for at least part of the route
Destination input or retrieval through interaction with a road map, e.g. selecting a POI icon on a road map
Reservations, e.g. for tickets, services or events
Dispatching vehicles on the basis of a location, e.g. taxi dispatching
Indicating the location of the monitored vehicles as destination, e.g. accidents, stolen, rental
Network architectures or network communication protocols for network security for authentication of entities using tickets, e.g. Kerberos
Hash functions, e.g. MD5, SHA, HMAC or f9 MAC
Authentication using certificates or pre-shared keys
Access security using delegated authorisation, e.g. open authorisation [OAuth] protocol
Services making use of location information using mutual or relative location information between multiple location based services [LBS] targets or of distance thresholds
Services for handling of emergency or hazardous situations, e.g. earthquake and tsunami warning systems [ETWS]
Network architectures or network communication protocols for network security for authentication of entities using certificates

Network architectures or network communication protocols for network security for controlling access to devices or network resources wherein the security policies are location-dependent, e.g. entities privileges depend on current location or allowing specific operations only from locally connected terminals
